course.subject: IELM
course.name: Computing in Industrial Applications
course.description: Introduction to microprocessor technologies and computer hardware with industrial applications. Computer systems for industrial control. Digital communication, mobile computing and RFID technology.

reviews.author: Anthony ho
reviews.title: It is an interesting subject
reviews.comment_content: This subject is difficult if you don't have any background knowledge in physic and computer.  IELM students with the knowledge of micro-processor controls and automations so that you are confident to work in high value added industries such as RFID systems, medical devices, and high end consumer products.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Proff and TA s is very helpful and help you to solve you problem.
The teacher will provide the lecture video for you so that you may study at home.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-Term Exam20%(Open-book exam.)
Final Exam34%(Open-book exam.)
Lab.work35%
Class & Lab Participation5% (get it by answer the question)
Assignment 24%
reviews.comment_workload:
Its workload is not much two easy homework and labs.
the lab is not difficult because the TA can help you a lot.

reviews.author: eleeag
reviews.comment_content: To equip IELM students with the knowledge of micro-processor controls and automations so that you are confident to work in high value added industries such as RFID systems, medical devices, and high end consumer products.
reviews.comment_grading:
Depending on the size of the class Eg. Out of 20 students, top 3 will get A+, subsequent 3 students get A, etc...
Course Grading:Mid-Term Exam20%(Open-book exam.)Final Exam34%(Open-book exam.)Lab.work35%(NO copying *)Class & Lab Participation5%AssignmentsAssignment 1 2%(NO copying *)Assignment 24%(NO copying *)100%
reviews.comment_workload: Low workload but labs can be quite time consuming
